lexUnit.name: remind.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause someone to think of (something) because of a resemblance

sentence.text: Even to pose such questions reminds us that there was a large element of chance in the emergence of Mrs Thatcher .
This reminds us that the pre-reading activities advocated by Langer , to which we referred above , will be especially useful for less fluent readers .
` I hope it reminded festival goers that in many countries , freedom of expression through words , never mind a literature festival , is just a dream . "
When Endill opened the door they creaked in the draught and it reminded him of the old hanging tree beside the front gate back home at Gibbet Hall .
That reminded her of their last argument .

Hilary Robarts 's sultry handsomeness emphasized her own very different look , an old-fashioned , carefully tended but unselfconscious prettiness which reminded him of photographs of the late thirties .
In fact , Andrew 's tone reminds me at times of Marc Bolan , particularly when he 's playing the percussive , rhythmic section across bars 4 and 5 .
` Michel said I reminded him of his audience at the time when he made speeches .
More than 6 ft tall with short hair and in his forties , Spiro is said to have reminded Waite of Sean Connery in his James Bond days .
At that moment , a warning pressure reminded him of its menacing presence .
As we tunnelled our way through the steep rhododendron-canopied paths at Aros , Alistair said the rain , the humidity and the terrain reminded him of his ` spell in Assam during the War .
The Old Gang Smelting Mills reminded me of an old deserted coal pit I played around as a child .
The blue should have reminded her of his flaming , instead of entrancing her by its own beauty , the beauty which had seemed to be utter and complete in itself .
` You remind me of her very much . "
The present generation of British and American literary Marxists remind me of the small boy in Joyce 's story , ` Araby " , who got to the bazaar just as it was closing .
He snorted through his nose instead of laughing , and emitted a curious whistling sound , reminding her of his snoring at night , which made the whole room vibrate and set ornaments rattling .
` You , " said Scarlet , ` sometimes remind me of my mum . "
For a moment , he reminded Melissa of Lou in his haste to defend a loved one , but she had seen how his knuckles whitened on hearing the story and guessed what he must be thinking .
She reminded Bowring of a streetwalker in some film , that image of a woman standing under a lamp surrounded by darkness .
The sight of an open pub told him how much time had passed and also reminded him of his normal comfort in moments of stress .
He reminded me of Benjamin with his dry wit , sardonic observations and palpable honesty .
Lydia put her head on one side , reminding Annie of a little sparrow with her darting beady eyes .
Her death reminded us of the dangers of complacency in Africa .
She reminds me of a small animal at bay .
Lawrence has demanded a battling performance after a Watford defeat that reminded him of the FA Cup knockout by Portsmouth .
The entertainment reminded Alix of the end-of-term pantomime at school , a regular feature of her own girlhood .
Pink flowers like willow herb clustered along a dried-up river bank , circling birds reminded her of the vultures in westerns .
It reminded me of the ghost in the horror film I had heard some of the older children talking about .
There was nothing to remind him of Eileen .
He reminded Riven a little of the Bicker he had known at the bothy .
It reminded her of the river bank where Pa and the boys went to cut rushes at weekends so that Ma and Billy could work all week .
I was reminded of the black iron horse silhouettes which decorate the Wolverhampton to Shrewsbury railway line in England .
She reminded Wycliffe of a satiated cat , licking her lips .
They and their disused railway lines remind us of wealth in the last century -- but unemployment during the last 50 years .
SEEING THE ARTICLE on the ` 109 in the July issue of FlyPast reminded me of the first time I saw it .
Dining a few nights later at the Beefsteak , I was reminded by a bright spark that Home Secretaries scarcely ever become Prime Ministers .
It is evident that Polybius self-consciously turned this meeting Into a Socratic episode , and Paul Friedlander was reminded of the opening scene of the " Greater Alcibiades " ( Am .
Their hope has been realized , by rather than for miscreants ; their rhetoric reminds us that Victorian values did not produce an orderly society .
On the lighter side it reminded him of Stamford and he wondered how Burden had got on .
The first 15 minutes of the second half reminded the tourists that the game was not yet won .
She must have reminded me in her remote stillness , her lucid silence , of someone I used to know , used to love .
Part of the cuff was visible and reminded him of Middy sleeping under the quilt .
The sky is reddening , reminding the viewer of the ghastly hues of the night sky above Auschwitz when the ovens were working at full capacity .
But songs like ` This Is How It Feels " and ` Commercial Rain " might perhaps remind America there is a world away from what Hollywood and the TV likes to project .
The manor house and Ferriby Hall are still extant and remind one of the former grandeur of the High Street .
Oh , that reminds me -- "
